channel.title: append on Güngör Budak
channel.description: Recent content in append on Güngör Budak

item.title: Python: extend() Append Elements of a List to a List
item.description: When you append a list to a list by using append() method, you’ll see your list is going to be appended as a list: >>>l=["a"] >>>l2=["a", "b"] >>>l.append(l2) >>>l ['a', ['a', 'b']] If you want to append elements of the list directly without creating nested lists, use extend() method: >>>l=["a"] >>>l2=["a", "b"] >>>l.extend(l2) >>>l ['a', 'a', 'b']
